00081 /* used when passing an MSHR index into the cache functions, but for
00082    whatever reason there's no corresponding MSHR entry */
00083 #define NO_MSHR (-1)
00084 
00085 /* This is used for latency prediction when a load completely misses in cache
00086    and has to go off to main memory */
00087 #define BIG_LATENCY 99999
00088 
00089 #define CACHE_STAT(x) {if(!cp->frozen) {x}}
00090 
00091 #define GET_BANK(x) (((x)>>cp->bank_shift) & cp->bank_mask)
00092 #define GET_MSHR_BANK(x) (((x)>>cp->bank_shift) & cp->MSHR_mask)
00093 
00094 /* CACHE_WRITEBACK is the same as CACHE_WRITE, except that CACHE_WRITEBACK does
00095    not cause the cache's replacement information/state to get updated. */
00096 enum cache_command { CACHE_NOP, CACHE_READ, CACHE_WRITE, CACHE_WRITEBACK, CACHE_PREFETCH, REFRESH, INVALIDATE, FWD_DIRTY, READ_RESPONSE, WRITE_RESPONSE, ACK };
00097 /*
00098 *  INVALIDATE= invalidate your entries from top to bottom
00099 *  FWD_DIRTY= Forward a line which should be dirty in your cache
00100 *  ACK= Acknowledgement of invalidate
00101 */
00102 enum repl_policy_t { REPLACE_LRU, REPLACE_MRU, REPLACE_RANDOM, REPLACE_NMRU, REPLACE_PLRU, REPLACE_CLOCK };
00103 enum alloc_policy_t { WRITE_ALLOC, NO_WRITE_ALLOC };
00104 enum write_policy_t { WRITE_THROUGH, WRITE_BACK };
00105 enum read_only_t { CACHE_READWRITE, CACHE_READONLY };
00106 enum coherence_state {MOD, EXC, SHR, INV};
00107 
00108 enum PF_state_t { PF_REFRAIN, PF_OK };
00109 
00110 struct cache_line_t {
00111   md_paddr_t tag;
00112   struct core_t * core; /* originating core */
00113   int way; /* which physical column/way am I in? */
00114   qword_t meta; /* additional field for replacment policy meta data */
00115   bool valid;
00116   enum coherence_state c_state;
00117   bool dirty;
00118   bool victim;
00119   bool prefetched;
00120   bool prefetch_used;
00121   struct cache_line_t * next;
00122 };
00123 
00124 struct cache_action_t {
00125   struct core_t * core; /* originating core */
00126   void * op;
00127   seq_t action_id;
00128   md_addr_t PC;
00129   md_paddr_t paddr;
00130   int MSHR_bank;
00131   int MSHR_index;
00132   bool miss_cb_invoked;
00133   enum cache_command cmd;
00134   struct cache_t * prev_cp;
00135   /* final call back on service-complete */
00136   void (*cb)(void * op); /* NULL = invalid/empty entry */
00137   /* callback on a miss, e.g., for speculative scheduling snatchback/replay */
00138   void (*miss_cb)(void * op, int expected_latency);
00139   bool (*translated_cb)(void * op, seq_t); /* returns true if TLB translation has completed */
00140   /* extract action_id; varies depending on whether we're dealing with a uop or IFQ entry */
00141   seq_t (*get_action_id)(void *);
00142   tick_t when_enqueued; /* primarily for MSHR's; used to provide FIFO scheduling */
00143   tick_t when_started;  /* primarily for MSHR's; set to TICK_T_MAX if in need of service */
00144   tick_t when_returned; /* primarily for MSHR's; set when value returned from higher level */
00145   tick_t pipe_exit_time; /* for tracking access latency */
00146   struct cache_action_t * MSHR_link; /* used for coalescing multiple MSHR requests to same addr */
00147   bool MSHR_linked; /* true if linked to earlier MSHR request */
00148 };
00149 
00150 struct cache_fill_t {
00151   int valid;
00152   md_paddr_t paddr;
00153   enum cache_command cmd;
00154   tick_t pipe_exit_time;
00155   struct core_t * core;
00156 };
00157 
00158 struct prefetch_buffer_t {
00159   md_paddr_t addr;
00160   struct prefetch_buffer_t * next;
00161 };
00162 
00163 struct prefetch_filter_t {
00164   char * table;
00165   int num_entries;
00166   int mask;
00167   int reset_interval;
00168   tick_t last_reset;
00169 };
00170 
00171 struct bus_t {
00172   char * name;
00173   int width; /* in bytes tranferrable per cycle */
00174   int ratio; /* number of cpu cycles per bus cycle */
00175   tick_t when_available;
00176 
00177   struct {
00178     counter_t accesses;
00179     counter_t utilization; /* cumulative cycles in use */
00180     counter_t prefetch_utilization; /* cumulative prefetch cycles in use */
00181   } stat;
00182 };
00183 
00184 struct cache_t {
00185 
00186   struct core_t * core; /* to which core does this belong? NULL = shared */
00187   struct uncore_t *uncore; /* to which uncore this belong? only if shared NULL = Private*/
00188 
00189   char * name;
00190   enum read_only_t read_only;
00191   bool frozen;
00192 
00193   int sets;
00194   int assoc;
00195   int log2_assoc; /* rounded up */
00196 
00197   int linesize;
00198   int addr_shift; /* to mask out the block offset */
00199 
00200   struct cache_line_t ** blocks;
00201 
00202   enum repl_policy_t replacement_policy;
00203   enum alloc_policy_t allocate_policy;
00204   enum write_policy_t write_policy;
00205 
00206   int banks;
00207   int bank_width; /* number of bytes read from a bank */
00208   int bank_shift;
00209   md_paddr_t bank_mask;
00210 
00211   const int begin_index;/* In case a shared cache what chunk lies with this cache*/
00212   const int end_index;
00213 
00214 
00215   int latency;
00216   int heap_size; /* for access event-Q heap */
00217   bool write_combining;
00218   struct cache_action_t ** pipe;    /* access pipeline for regular reads/writes */
00219   int * pipe_num; /* number of requests present in each bank */
00220 
00221   struct cache_fill_t ** fill_pipe; /* pipeline used to fill the cache from higher levels; one per bank */
00222   int * fill_num; /* number of fill requests present in each bank */
00223 
00224   /* miss status handling registers */
00225   int MSHR_banks; /* num MSHR banks */
00226   int MSHR_mask;
00227   int MSHR_size;
00228   enum cache_command * MSHR_cmd_order;
00229   int * MSHR_num; /* num MSHR entries occupied */
00230   int * MSHR_num_pf; /* num MSHR entries occupied by prefetch requests (from this level) */
00231   int * MSHR_fill_num; /* num MSHR entries pending to fill current level */
00232   int * MSHR_unprocessed_num; /* outstanding requests still waiting to go to next level */
00233   struct cache_action_t ** MSHR;
00234   int start_point;
00235 
00236   /* write-back buffers (only for write-back caches) - these are banked if MSHR is banked */
00237   int WBB_size;
00238   int * WBB_num;
00239   int * WBB_head;
00240   int * WBB_tail;
00241   struct cache_line_t ** WBB;
00242 
00243   /* prefetch FIFO */
00244   int PFF_size; /* PFB = PreFetch FIFO */
00245   int PFF_num;
00246   int PFF_head;
00247   int PFF_tail;
00248   struct PFF_t {
00249     md_addr_t PC;
00250     md_paddr_t addr;
00251     struct core_t * core;
00252   } * PFF;
00253 
00254   struct prefetch_t ** prefetcher;
00255   int num_prefetchers;
00256   /* prefetch control */
00257   int prefetch_threshold; /* only perform prefetch if MSHR occupancy is less than this threshold */
00258   int prefetch_max; /* max number of prefetch requests in MSHRs (from this level) */
00259   bool prefetch_on_miss; /* if true, prefetches only generated from miss traffic; else from all accesses */
00260 
00261   enum PF_state_t PF_state;
00262   int PF_last_sample; /* cumulative uncore utilization at last sample point */
00263   int PF_sample_interval;
00264   double PF_low_watermark;  /* {0.0 ... 1.0} */
00265   double PF_high_watermark; /* {0.0 ... 1.0} */
00266 
00267   struct prefetch_buffer_t * PF_buffer;
00268   int PF_buffer_size; /* num entries */
00269   struct prefetch_filter_t * PF_filter;
00270 
00271   /* to next level (toward main memory), e.g., DL1's next-level points to the LLC */
00272   struct cache_t * next_level;
00273   struct cache_t * prev_level;
00274   struct bus_t * next_bus;
00275 
00276   /* flags to indicate when there's nothing for the cache to do; helps
00277      speed up simulation */
00278   bool check_for_work;
00279   bool check_for_MSHR_fill_work;
00280   bool check_for_fill_work;
00281   bool check_for_pipe_work;
00282   bool check_for_MSHR_work;
00283   bool check_for_WBB_work;
00284 
00285   struct {
00286     counter_t load_lookups;
00287     counter_t load_misses;
00288     counter_t store_lookups;
00289     counter_t store_misses;
00290     counter_t writeback_lookups;
00291     counter_t writeback_misses;
00292     counter_t prefetch_lookups;
00293     counter_t prefetch_misses;
00294     counter_t prefetch_insertions;
00295     counter_t prefetch_useful_insertions;
00296     counter_t MSHR_occupancy; /* total occupancy */
00297     counter_t MSHR_full_cycles; /* number of cycles when full */
00298     counter_t WBB_insertions; /* total writebacks */
00299     counter_t WBB_victim_insertions; /* total non-dirty insertions */
00300     counter_t WBB_combines; /* number eliminated due to write combining */
00301     counter_t WBB_occupancy; /* total occupancy */
00302     counter_t WBB_full_cycles; /* number of cycles when full */
00303     counter_t WBB_hits;
00304     counter_t WBB_victim_hits;
00305     counter_t *core_lookups;
00306     counter_t *core_misses;
00307     counter_t MSHR_combos;
00308     counter_t uncore_utilization;/*This is only valid for the last level cache It is a measure of the traffic that is enqueued into the controller*/
00309   } stat;
00310 };

00496 /* since these cache functions cannot directly set the core->oracle.hosed
00497    bit, they just return and depend on the rest of the core state getting
00498    hosed to force a reset. */
00499 #ifndef cache_fatal
00500 #ifdef DEBUG
00501 #define cache_fatal(msg, retval) fatal(msg)
00502 #else
00503 #define cache_fatal(msg, retval) { \
00504   fprintf(stderr,"fatal (%s,%d:%s): ",__FILE__,__LINE__,cp->name); \
00505   fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",msg); \
00506   return (retval); \
00507 }
00508 #endif
00509 #endif
00510 
00511 #ifndef cache_assert
00512 #ifdef DEBUG
00513 #define cache_assert(cond, retval) assert(cond)
00514 #else
00515 #define cache_assert(cond, retval) { \
00516   if(!(cond)) { \
00517     fprintf(stderr,"assertion failed (%s,%d:%s): ",__FILE__,__LINE__,cp->name); \
00518     fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",#cond); \
00519     return (retval); \
00520   } \
00521 }
00522 #endif
00523 #endif
